Week 18

Flutters & Fries

This week we haven‚Äôt been up to much, just enjoying spending our evenings watching the Chase, Pointless and Tipping Point. Laura thinks she may have felt the first flutters of marshmallow moving around inside which is amazing! Her emotions are slightly heightened at the moment‚Ä¶ I say this because I went to McDonalds without asking Laura if she wanted anything and it did not go down well. Laura may or may not have cried because I didn't even get her fries... and apparently she'd NEVER do that to me!

Week 19 & 20

The Kicking Marshmallow

Laura has said she‚Äôs definitely started to feel the baby move. She wasn‚Äôt quite sure last week but has said that she can definitely feel Marshmallow moving around in there. I haven‚Äôt felt the baby move just yet, it will be another few weeks until I feel the little kicks! We're struggling to think of boys names we can agree on and have about 4 girls names we love.

We're having a boy!!! Marshmallow is doing great and measuring perfectly. We both thought it may be a girl so the shock and surprise of finding out it‚Äôs a little boy was amazing! The doctor turned on the 3D scan for a couple of minutes and baby had his fists up to his face like a boxer..that‚Äôs my boy!!

Mammy's Birthday

This week was Laura‚Äôs birthday so I decided to surprise her with a night away in Cork and a trip to Fota Wildlife Park as it‚Äôs somewhere she‚Äôs always wanted to go. I packed us a picnic for the day and off we went. She was so surprised and delighted when she saw where we were going. We had a great day and went for a swim and then dinner in the hotel later that night.

Laura also got a huge surprise when her sister Sandra flew home from England a couple days later to spend her birthday with her. We all had a such a lovely time celebrating Laura's Birthday and Marshmallow joined in with some little birthday kicks.

Marshmallow's Measurements

Marshmallow's weighs about 10 1/2 ounces now. He's also around 6 1/2 inches long from head to bottom and about 10 inches from head to heel. Marshmallow is swallowing more these days, which is good practice for his digestive system. He's also producing meconium, a black, sticky by-product of digestion, which we'll see in his first nappy.
